revised_title: Description of a Metalline Thermometer and Its Inventor
tldr: Maurice Johnson, President of the Gentlemen's Society at Spalding, shares a letter about a metalline thermometer invented by Samuel Frotheringham and made by John Ingram. The thermometer is made of an iron staff with a brass bar, and it accurately measures temperature. Johnson also mentions a similar instrument invented by him in 1735, which was exposed to various weather conditions.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Instrumentation and Measurement
